Hi all.  I am a relatively new programmer and am wondering if you folks can help me out.  I am working a very simple program via Quest to be used in an Escape Room that I am building.  I have written the code fine so far, everything works as I need to, and I have even figured out how to hide the Location bar and Panels to the right (woo!).  

I need this program to be as "idiot" proof as possible.  As such, is there any way to hide the toolbar at the top from players?  The less players have access to, the less of a headache for my staff and I.  They do not need access to the File, Edit, View, Tools, or Help commands whatsoever for my purposes.  I have scoured the forums but cannot seem to find a solution to this, if there is one at all.

Thanks very much for your help!

Posts.EditableText: are you trying to run your game (or whatever it is you're building), in a browser or the standalone version? The games here, that run in the browser do not have toolbars, but the browser itself does - and you'd have to disable that tool bar in the browser (which you can't completely do).
